channel.title: Window 7 Help!
channel.description:
[code=java] 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . . [/code] This is what i get when i try to run my server.
[code=java] The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . . [/code] This is what i get when i try to compile my server. [hr] I've been in the whole server thing for a while now and the only reason i don't know is because i've got a new computer and it's a 64 bit windows 7 and I'm not sure what the "Classpath" or "Path" is suppose to be i need help because i don't wont to hurt my computer because I've spent a lot of money on it.
Would any of you guys mind giving me a "Path" and a "Classpath" for my windows 7 64 bit computer.
All help is much appreciated.
Thanks.

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Okay, I’ve re-downloaded java and all now. When i compile i’m getting this error.

Error occurred during initialization of VM
java/lang/NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/Object
Press any key to continue . . .

I need help please, Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Opium10, post:7, topic:357073”]Thank you, the run is working now. The compiler still has this error.

The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

In windows explorer, go to “C:\Program Files\Java” and tell me what folders are there.

Read full topic

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Thank you, the run is working now. The compiler still has this error.

The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Are you sure that you’re using version 20 of the JDK? The path is pointing directly at the file:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe

With your Run batch file, replace:

java server

With:

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" server

Read full topic

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

Okay sure, but i know for a fact that it is the “Path” and “Classpath” because i haven’t added because i’m not sure on what they are.
[hr]
These are the codes.

@echo off
title Compiler
cd Source
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java
pause

That was the compiler code.

@echo off
cd Source/Bin
title Run Server
java server
pause

That was the code for running the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Window 7 Help!
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

I’m talking about the code in the batch file; right click the batch file, click edit and post the the codes for both of your batch files here.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Opium10 Opium10
item.description:
@Opium10 wrote:

I’ve posted what the batch files say, that’s what in the code boxes are.

I’m using version 20.

Read full topic

'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .

This is what i get when i try to run my server.

The system cannot find the path specified.
Press any key to continue . . .

This is what i get when i try to compile my server.
[hr]
I’ve been in the whole server thing for a while now and the only reason i don’t know is because i’ve got a new computer and it’s a 64 bit windows 7 and I’m not sure what the “Classpath” or “Path” is suppose to be i need help because i don’t wont to hurt my computer because I’ve spent a lot of money on it.

Would any of you guys mind giving me a “Path” and a “Classpath” for my windows 7 64 bit computer.

All help is much appreciated.

Thanks.
